pr_title: Add nodeBreakerView.hasAttachedEquipment(node) method + Ensure an IIDM node number is valid before trying to use it in CGMES conversion

timeline.bodyText: Not related to this PR, but this TODO could be removed.
timeline.author: mathbagu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -68,34 +69,34 @@ private VoltageLevel newBoundarySubstationVoltageLevel() {
         String substationName = "boundary";
         String vlName = "boundary";
         return context.network()
-                .newSubstation()
-                .setId(context.namingStrategy().getId("Substation", substationId))
-                .setName(substationName)
-                // TODO(mathbagu): Country should be optional. This will be done in another PR.
-                // A non-null country code must be set
-                // This is an arbitrary country code, Bangladesh code BD also matches with
-                // BounDary
-                .setCountry(boundaryCountryCode())
-                .add()
-                .newVoltageLevel()
-                .setId(context.namingStrategy().getId("VoltageLevel", vlId))
-                .setName(vlName)
-                .setNominalV(nominalVoltage)
-                .setTopologyKind(context.nodeBreaker() ? TopologyKind.NODE_BREAKER : TopologyKind.BUS_BREAKER)
-                .add();
+            .newSubstation()
+            .setId(context.namingStrategy().getId("Substation", substationId))
+            .setName(substationName)
+            // TODO(mathbagu): Country should be optional. This will be done in another PR.
+            // A non-null country code must be set
+            // This is an arbitrary country code, Bangladesh code BD also matches with
+            // BounDary

timeline.bodyText: Not related to this PR, but CalculatedBus and ConfiguredBus are implementation specific and should not appear in this message
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: What error message do you suggest?
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText:
Somethink like that:

Can't find a bus from the Bus View to set Voltage and Angle, we use the bus {} from the Bus/Breaker view. Connectivity node {}
replies.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure we should assume that, or we should update the documentation.
Anyway, is it the best way to check if a terminal is associated to this node: maybe we should add a convenient method to get an Optional<Terminal> from a node?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: It is not enough because a node is still valid if an internal connection or a switch is attached to it (with no terminal)... I added a convenient method to check if there is any equipment attached to the node at NodeBreakerView level to delete this method.
replies.author: miovd

timeline.message:
Use hasAttachedEquipment for CGMES node conversion

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: @zamarrenolm you should configure your IDE to set to 8 spaces the continuous indentation.

         return context.network()

-                .setName(substationName)
-                // TODO(mathbagu): Country should be optional. This will be done in another PR.

-                // This is an arbitrary country code, Bangladesh code BD also matches with
-                // BounDary
-                .setCountry(boundaryCountryCode())
-                .add()

-                .setId(context.namingStrategy().getId("VoltageLevel", vlId))
-                .setName(vlName)
-                .setNominalV(nominalVoltage)
-                .setTopologyKind(context.nodeBreaker() ? TopologyKind.NODE_BREAKER : TopologyKind.BUS_BREAKER)
-                .add();
